alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 28 at 2:05PM MDT until July 28 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM MDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following counties, Cheyenne and Kit Carson. * WHEN...Until 2 AM MDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Portions of Kit Carson and Cheyenne counties have received several inches of rainfall in the past 24 hours, especially in areas along and south of Interstate 70 from Stratton to Bethune. Storms that are expected later this afternoon and evening will be slow moving and will be impactful due to locally heavy rainfall. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
